text:
Is there a way to retrieve the object that a GridLayout entry was set to? I.e.:

```ax = layout[1, 1] = Axis(scene, title = "title")```
`ax == layout[1,1]` returns false which is a bit weird, but regardless if I no longer have `ax` it seems I should somehow be able to retrieve it from `layout[1,1]` , but how?

elements.text: Is there a way to retrieve the object that a GridLayout entry was set to? I.e.:
returns false which is a bit weird, but regardless if I no longer have
it seems I should somehow be able to retrieve it from

text: There's `contents` / `content` that you can call on figure positions / grid layout positions. There can be multiple objects at a given location so indexing doesn't retrieve objects directly but creates intermediary objects useful for other functions
